ntidArea.name: ASL Storyteller: A Visual Language App for Kids!
ntidArea.description: ASL Storyteller is an early childhood educational app that reinforces their first language system through visual language. It utilizes a unique way of telling interactive stories in American Sign Language that keeps Deaf culture at its adapted forefront. i.e. Characters in our stories are showing Deaf etiquette, Deaf way of communicating and providing interactive components to encourage both parents and their children to 'co-learn'.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Joo Yeon Chang, Logan Lugo, Julie Love

ntidArea.name: ASLNet: Video Captioning American Sign Language
ntidArea.description: Imagine a scenario where you don't know american sign language and wanted to talk to someone who's Deaf/Hard of Hearing (DHH). While you could type your messages on a phone, it is not sufficient to facilitate a natural mode of communication between the speakers - the modes being 'speech' for the hearing and 'sign language' for the DHH. In this exhibit, you'll see a machine that can automatically interpret American Sign Language and display it on a screen.

ntidArea.name: Cherry: Sound Localization for People Who are DHH
ntidArea.description: Cherry is an assistive wearable device aimed to aid people who are DHH (deaf or hard of hearing). Only 20% of the total numbers of people with hearing disabilities use some kind of aid in their day to day lives. Some of the factors that keep people from using these hearing aids include stigma towards people wearing these devices, value in terms of functionality provided by the aid, maintenance, efficiency etc. Cherry aims to get rid of the stigma associated with devices that aid people who are DHH.

ntidArea.name: Deaf Pioneers Adventure App Development
ntidArea.description: This exhibit highlights some innovative features in 3-D adventure storytelling and gaming. This app takes users on a first- and third-person narration through animation, gaming and language texts (ASL and English) about Lauren Redden Searing who was a deaf poet and journalist in the United States during the late nineteenth century.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Christopher Kurz, Gary Behm, Heather Smith-Schmitz, Jenny Sipiora, Ashley Wood, Aaron Nusbaum, Alexis Lazaro

ntidArea.name: Deaf Restaurant
ntidArea.description: We want to ask you for food/sauce flavor ideas for our startup restaurant business this year (or next year). Please visit us and fill out our ten-question survey to help us collect information.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Yeh Kim, Andrew Cho, Faith Benton

ntidArea.name: Goodbye, Goodbuy!
ntidArea.description: What happens to your furniture when you move out in the spring? Does it get tossed in the dumpster and sent to a landfill? Goodbye, Goodbuy! has made it their mission to reduce RIT's landfill contributions, and instead extend the life cycle of your dorm room accessories. See the cycle that Goodbye, Goodbuy! has implemented for unwanted furniture, clothing, and odds 'n ends!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Erica Hickey, Benjamin Hamilton, Leandra Baldwin

ntidArea.name: On-Call Interpreter Queuing App
ntidArea.description: Have you ever needed Interpreter services last minute? Have you had difficulty scheduling short term interpreter support? If any of you have had experience with this you will know it can be a difficult and stressful experience! But, this App is designed to schedule short term appointments between RIT students and faculty with Interpreters in a direct and efficient manner. Come by to test the app and provide us with your suggestions and insights!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Jocelyn Lazo, David Stolze, Andrew Kline, Joan Bempong

ntidArea.name: Rochester Bridges to the Doctorate Program
ntidArea.description: Are you Deaf or Hard of Hearing and interested in becoming a scientist or know someone who is? The Rochester Bridges to the Doctorate Program is the first of its kind that provides master's level mentoring and guidance toward admission to a doctoral degree program in biomedical and behavioral science disciplines. Come see us to learn more about the opportunities we have available!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Nikki Cherry, Peter Hauser, Scott Smith, Jess Cuculick, Jeff Shaul, Andrea Amati, Sara Blick, PJ Simpson-Haidaris

ntidArea.name: Scrap Value Extraction for Markin Tubing
ntidArea.description: Markin Tubing LP has recently approved the Scrap Value Extraction Project in support of its vision to utilize the scrap metal generated from its production processes. The profits of the company could be increased substantially if the value of the scrap metal can be increased or harnessed more efficiently. The study is done primarily to look at various innovative ways through how the scarp could be more useful to the company both to sell as a bulk or to include it in its production process.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Julissa Pozo Nu√±ez, Aleyca De Leon Roman, Asim Wankhade

ntidArea.name: Sign Language to Text
ntidArea.description: ASL to Text attempts to bridge the gap between the deaf and hearing communities by creating a system of automatic interpretation of sign language. Although many different technologies exist for transcribing voice to text, only a few technologies exist for transcribing sign language to text. Unfortunately these solutions are fairly expensive. ASL to Text is free (as it relies on webcams) and open source.
ntidArea.exhibitors: Nicholas Wilkins, Michael Johnson, Nikolas Kelly, Emily Thomas, Kyle Cutler, Caroline Davis, Edith Dong

ntidArea.name: SK8MAG: Magnetic Connection for Bags
ntidArea.description: A Magnetic coupling on the backpack to attach/detach any carry on items from the backpack with ease. This is especially useful when you're quickly on the go or need an extra hand to carry more items. Ideal for hikers, athletes, and transporters.

ntidArea.name: Tiger Media
ntidArea.description: This is an opportunity for our tiger media organization at NTID to advertise about us with freebies plus we will have photobooth, too.

ntidArea.name: Translation MAGIC!
ntidArea.description: Join us at the Fireside Lounge in the Student Alumni Union for Translation MAGIC!

ntidArea.name: Wavio
ntidArea.description: Are you tired of missing the sounds of fire alarm, doorbell, baby crying, water faucet running, and countless of sounds in your home? Stop buying those individual devices to capture and identify all the critical sounds. We have an all-in-one solution for you!
ntidArea.exhibitors: Spencer Montan, Greyson Watkins , Nicholas Lamb , Zachary Baltzer
